LanguageData.Badger_Westerado.label: badger
LanguageData.Badger_Westerado.description: A small, extremely hardy animal that ranges wide across forests and shrubland. It's not afraid of much and can be quite aggressive.
LanguageData.Badger_Westerado.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.Badger_Westerado.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.Badger_Westerado.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.BrownDonkey_Westerado.label: brown donkey
LanguageData.BrownDonkey_Westerado.description: A common donkey. Makes a good companion for crossing large swaths of harsh terrain. Can survive off sparse amounts of food.
LanguageData.BrownDonkey_Westerado.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.BrownDonkey_Westerado.tools.2.label: left hoof
LanguageData.BrownDonkey_Westerado.tools.3.label: right hoof
LanguageData.BlackDonkey_Westerado.label: black donkey
LanguageData.BlackDonkey_Westerado.description: A strong, fast donkey. Makes a formidable foe in combat and an excellent companion on the range.
LanguageData.BlackDonkey_Westerado.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.BlackDonkey_Westerado.tools.2.label: left hoof
LanguageData.BlackDonkey_Westerado.tools.3.label: right hoof
LanguageData.GreyDonkey_Westerado.label: grey donkey
LanguageData.GreyDonkey_Westerado.description: The fastest donkey in the rim. Valued for its quick nature and its beautiful looks. Also quite gluttunous.
LanguageData.GreyDonkey_Westerado.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.GreyDonkey_Westerado.tools.2.label: left hoof
LanguageData.GreyDonkey_Westerado.tools.3.label: right hoof
LanguageData.GilaMonster_Westerado.label: gila monster
LanguageData.GilaMonster_Westerado.description: These medium-sized lizards feed on smaller animals. \n\nDon't let Gila Monsters fool you; their sluggish nature hides quite a dangerous bite.
LanguageData.GilaMonster_Westerado.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.GilaMonster_Westerado.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.GilaMonster_Westerado.tools.2.label: bite
LanguageData.GilaMonster_Westerado.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Moose_Westerado.label: moose
LanguageData.Moose_Westerado.description: A very large member of the deer family, well-adapted to life in cold climates. Domesticated moose can be milked, but refuse to carry packs.
LanguageData.Moose_Westerado.tools.0.label: antlers
LanguageData.Moose_Westerado.tools.1.label: left hoof
LanguageData.Moose_Westerado.tools.2.label: right hoof
LanguageData.Moose_Westerado.tools.4.label: head
LanguageData.Bison_Westerado.label: bison
LanguageData.Bison_Westerado.description: A large-sized herding herbivore. Generally peaceful unless disturbed.
LanguageData.Bison_Westerado.tools.0.label: horns
LanguageData.Bison_Westerado.tools.1.label: horns
LanguageData.Bison_Westerado.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Coyote_Westerado.label: coyote
LanguageData.Coyote_Westerado.description: Small wolf-like creatures that hunt in packs. If disturbed in the wild, they are very likely to attack.
LanguageData.Coyote_Westerado.tools.0.label: left claw
LanguageData.Coyote_Westerado.tools.1.label: right claw
LanguageData.Coyote_Westerado.tools.2.label: bite
LanguageData.Coyote_Westerado.tools.3.label: head
LanguageData.Rattlesnake_Westerado.label: rattlesnake
LanguageData.Rattlesnake_Westerado.description: A large predatory snake. Rattlesnakes can be highly aggressive if provoked, and their bite injects toxic venom into the victim.
LanguageData.Rattlesnake_Westerado.tools.0.label: venom-fangs
LanguageData.Rattlesnake_Westerado.tools.1.label: head
LanguageData.Elk_Westerado.label: wapiti
LanguageData.Elk_Westerado.description: A large member of the deer family, well-adapted to life in cold climates. Domesticated wapiti can be milked, but refuse to carry packs.
LanguageData.Elk_Westerado.tools.0.label: left hoof
LanguageData.Elk_Westerado.tools.1.label: right hoof
LanguageData.Elk_Westerado.tools.3.label: head
